personas.name: iOS Developer — First Integration
personas.background: Senior iOS developer at a subscription-based app. First time using Adapty. Comfortable with Swift/SwiftUI, familiar with StoreKit basics but wants to avoid dealing with receipt validation and subscription logic directly.
goals: Integrate Adapty SDK into existing iOS app
Set up paywalls and products
Test purchases in sandbox
Go live with confidence
pain_points: Complex Apple documentation for in-app purchases
Unclear mapping between App Store Connect products and Adapty concepts
Testing subscription edge cases (renewals, cancellations, grace periods)
Ensuring nothing breaks in production
typical_questions: How do I install the SDK?
How do I show a paywall?
How do I test purchases?
What's the minimum code I need?
How do I handle purchase errors?

scenarios.name: First-time SDK integration
scenarios.goal: Get Adapty working in an existing iOS app with a basic paywall
success_criteria: Found and completed store setup (App Store credentials, S2S notifications)
Installed SDK and initialized it with API key
Displayed a paywall and handled a purchase
Successfully ran a sandbox test purchase
Found and reviewed the release checklist

scenarios.name: Add a paywall with Paywall Builder
scenarios.goal: Create and display a visually designed paywall
success_criteria: Created a paywall in the dashboard using the visual builder
Linked products to the paywall
Created a placement and assigned the paywall
Fetched and displayed the paywall in Swift code
Handled purchase events (success, failure, restore)

scenarios.name: Debug failing test purchases
scenarios.goal: Figure out why sandbox purchases aren't working
success_criteria: Found troubleshooting guide for common sandbox issues
Found platform-specific error codes and their meanings
Identified whether the issue is store-side, Adapty-side, or code-side

personas.name: Cross-platform Developer (React Native / Flutter)
personas.background: Full-stack or mobile developer building with React Native (Expo or bare) or Flutter. Manages both iOS and Android from a single codebase. Needs to handle platform differences without duplicating work.
goals: Install Adapty SDK in cross-platform project
Handle both App Store and Google Play from one codebase
Display paywalls that work on both platforms
Understand platform-specific setup that can't be abstracted away
pain_points: Native module installation issues (especially with Expo)
Different store setup requirements for iOS vs Android
Platform-specific behavior not documented together
Unclear which docs apply to cross-platform vs native-only
typical_questions: Does the React Native SDK work with Expo?
Do I need to configure both App Store and Google Play separately?
Are paywalls identical on both platforms?
How do I handle platform-specific purchase flows?
What's different between the Flutter and React Native SDKs?

scenarios.name: Set up Adapty in a React Native Expo app
scenarios.goal: Get Adapty running in an Expo-managed project for both iOS and Android
success_criteria: Configured both App Store and Google Play in Adapty dashboard
Installed the React Native SDK in an Expo project without native module issues
Displayed a paywall that works on both platforms
Tested purchases on both iOS and Android

scenarios.name: Display Paywall Builder paywalls in Flutter
scenarios.goal: Show a visually built paywall in a Flutter app
success_criteria: Fetched paywall configuration in Dart code
Rendered the paywall widget
Handled button actions and purchase events

personas.name: Developer Migrating from RevenueCat
personas.background: Developer whose team decided to switch from RevenueCat to Adapty. Already has a live app with active subscribers. Needs to migrate without losing data or disrupting existing users. Knows subscription infrastructure concepts well.
goals: Understand Adapty equivalents of RevenueCat concepts
Migrate without subscriber data loss
Run both SDKs in parallel during transition
Preserve existing subscription analytics
pain_points: Fear of losing subscriber data during migration
Different terminology (entitlements vs access levels, offerings vs placements)
Need to maintain backward compatibility during rollout
Unclear timeline for full migration
typical_questions: What's the Adapty equivalent of RevenueCat entitlements?
Can I run both SDKs at the same time?
How do I import historical subscriber data?
What's Observer mode and when do I use it?
Will I lose analytics data during migration?

scenarios.name: Plan and execute RevenueCat migration
scenarios.goal: Switch from RevenueCat to Adapty without disrupting existing subscribers
success_criteria: Found a concept mapping (RevenueCat term → Adapty equivalent)
Understood Observer mode and when to use it during migration
Found instructions for importing historical subscriber data
Knew how to run both SDKs in parallel safely
Found a release/migration checklist

personas.name: Backend Developer
personas.background: Backend engineer responsible for the app's server infrastructure. Needs to integrate Adapty's server-side API for subscription checks, webhook processing, and syncing web payments with mobile. Works with REST APIs daily.
goals: Check subscription status from the server
Receive and process subscription events via webhooks
Sync web (Stripe/Paddle) purchases with mobile subscriptions
Export analytics data for custom reporting
pain_points: API authentication and authorization setup
Understanding webhook event types and their meanings
Mapping subscription states across platforms
Ensuring idempotent webhook processing
typical_questions: How do I authenticate API requests?
What events does the webhook send?
How do I sync Stripe subscriptions with mobile?
What's the API rate limit?
How do I export analytics data programmatically?

scenarios.name: Set up server-side subscription checks
scenarios.goal: Verify a user's subscription status from the backend
success_criteria: Found API authentication method and obtained keys
Found the correct endpoint for checking subscription/profile status
Understood the response format and subscription states

scenarios.name: Process subscription events via webhooks
scenarios.goal: Receive real-time subscription events on the server
success_criteria: Configured webhook URL and selected events in dashboard
Understood the event payload structure
Found how to test webhook delivery
Understood retry behavior and error handling

scenarios.name: Sync web payments with mobile
scenarios.goal: Unify Stripe web subscriptions with mobile app access
success_criteria: Found the Stripe integration setup
Understood the API flow for syncing web purchases to Adapty profiles
Knew how to grant access levels via API

scenarios.name: Export analytics data
scenarios.goal: Pull analytics data into internal data warehouse
success_criteria: Found available export methods (API vs automated S3/GCS)
Understood API authentication for the export API
Knew what data formats and fields are available

personas.name: Product Manager Evaluating Adapty
personas.background: PM at a mobile-first company with a subscription app. Evaluating Adapty as a potential subscription infrastructure provider. Needs to understand capabilities, integration effort, and analytics depth before recommending to the team. Not writing code but needs to understand technical trade-offs.
goals: Understand Adapty's full feature set
Assess integration effort and timeline
Evaluate analytics and A/B testing capabilities
Compare with current solution or alternatives
Build a business case for adoption
pain_points: Documentation assumes you've already decided to use the product
Hard to find high-level feature overview without diving into implementation details
No clear integration timeline or effort estimates
Analytics capabilities buried in separate chart-specific pages
typical_questions: What can Adapty do?
How long does integration take?
What analytics and metrics are available?
How does A/B testing work?
What integrations are supported?
How does Adapty compare to RevenueCat?

scenarios.name: Evaluate Adapty for the team
scenarios.goal: Understand if Adapty fits the team's needs and estimate adoption effort
success_criteria: Got a clear picture of Adapty's feature set without reading SDK docs
Found an estimate of integration effort or complexity
Understood A/B testing capabilities and limitations
Found which third-party tools integrate with Adapty
Found migration path from current tool (e.g., RevenueCat)

scenarios.name: Understand analytics depth
scenarios.goal: Determine if Adapty analytics can replace current analytics setup
success_criteria: Understood how Adapty collects and processes data
Found a full list of available metrics and charts
Understood LTV, cohort, funnel, and retention analysis capabilities
Found whether predictive analytics is available

personas.name: Growth / Marketing Manager
personas.background: Responsible for user acquisition, monetization optimization, and campaign ROI at a subscription app company. Runs A/B tests on paywalls, manages attribution integrations, and uses Apple Ads Manager. Not a developer but configures tools in dashboards.
goals: Optimize paywall conversion through A/B testing
Track attribution and campaign ROI
Segment users for targeted offers
Manage Apple Search Ads campaigns from Adapty
Understand which acquisition channels drive the most LTV
pain_points: A/B test setup requires understanding placements and audiences
Attribution integration docs are developer-oriented
Hard to find marketing-relevant features without wading through SDK docs
Apple Ads Manager is a newer feature with evolving docs
typical_questions: How do I set up an A/B test for our paywall?
How do I create user segments?
How does attribution work with AppsFlyer/Adjust?
How do I use Apple Ads Manager?
What does Adapty UA offer vs third-party attribution?
How do I read A/B test results?
Can I target specific audiences with different paywalls?

scenarios.name: Run a paywall A/B test
scenarios.goal: Test two paywall variants to find which converts better
success_criteria: Understood which A/B test type to use
Created variant paywalls and assigned them to a placement
Launched the test
Found how to read results and determine statistical significance

scenarios.name: Set up attribution tracking
scenarios.goal: Connect AppsFlyer or Adjust to track campaign performance with subscription revenue
success_criteria: Understood how third-party integrations work in Adapty
Configured a specific attribution provider (AppsFlyer, Adjust, etc.)
Selected which events to send
Found how to monitor integration health

scenarios.name: Manage Apple Search Ads
scenarios.goal: Use Adapty's Apple Ads Manager for campaign analytics and optimization
success_criteria: Connected Apple Search Ads account to Adapty
Understood available metrics and analytics views
Found how to create/manage campaigns
Found automation capabilities

scenarios.name: Explore Adapty UA as attribution alternative
scenarios.goal: Understand if Adapty UA can replace third-party attribution
success_criteria: Understood what Adapty UA offers vs third-party tools
Found setup steps for tracking links
Found which ad networks integrate (Meta, TikTok, etc.)
Could assess whether UA meets the team's attribution needs

personas.name: Data Analyst
personas.background: Responsible for subscription analytics, reporting, and data pipeline at a mobile app company. Needs to extract data from Adapty for custom dashboards, cohort analysis, and executive reporting. Comfortable with SQL, APIs, and data tools.
goals: Export raw subscription data for custom analysis
Build cohort-based retention and LTV reports
Set up automated data pipelines from Adapty
Understand how Adapty calculates its metrics
Create custom funnels and conversion analysis
pain_points: Need to understand Adapty's metric definitions to reconcile with internal data
Export options (S3, API, webhooks) scattered across different doc sections
Analytics calculation methodology not always transparent
Unclear which data is available via API vs only in dashboard
typical_questions: How does Adapty calculate MRR/LTV/churn?
How do I export raw transaction data?
Can I set up automated exports to S3?
What's available in the Analytics Export API?
How do cohorts work in Adapty?
What's the data refresh frequency?

scenarios.name: Set up automated data export
scenarios.goal: Get subscription data flowing into the company's data warehouse automatically
success_criteria: Found all available export methods (S3, GCS, API)
Understood data format, schema, and delivery schedule
Set up authentication for the chosen export method

scenarios.name: Understand Adapty's analytics methodology
scenarios.goal: Reconcile Adapty metrics with internal data and understand calculation differences
success_criteria: Understood data collection and processing methodology
Found precise definitions for key metrics (Revenue, MRR, LTV)
Understood how cohorts are defined and tracked
Found available filters, grouping options, and proceeds types

scenarios.name: Build conversion funnel analysis
scenarios.goal: Analyze install-to-trial-to-paid conversion funnel
success_criteria: Understood funnel analysis capabilities in Adapty
Found conversion metrics and breakdowns
Found retention analysis by cohort
Knew about scheduled reporting options

personas.name: Beginner Developer
personas.background: Early-career or self-taught developer building their first subscription app. Knows one language (Swift or Kotlin) at a basic level. Hasn't worked with in-app purchases, service accounts, or API keys before. Follows tutorials step by step and gets stuck when docs assume prior knowledge.
goals: Build a working subscription app as a learning project or first commercial app
Understand what in-app purchases are and how they work
Follow a complete path from zero to a working paywall
Avoid costly mistakes with store configurations
pain_points: Docs assume familiarity with App Store Connect / Google Play Console
Terms like 'service account', 'server notifications', 'S2S' are unexplained
Unclear which steps are iOS-only, Android-only, or both
Package managers (SPM, CocoaPods, Gradle) assumed as known
No explanation of why each step matters, just how
Error messages are confusing without context
typical_questions: What is a service account and why do I need one?
What's the difference between sandbox and production?
Do I need a paid Apple Developer account?
What's a paywall?
What does 'access level' mean?
Why do I need server notifications?
What's CocoaPods / SPM and which should I use?

scenarios.name: First subscription app (iOS)
scenarios.goal: Go from zero to a working paywall in an iOS app, understanding each step
success_criteria: Understood what Adapty is without needing prior subscription knowledge
Completed App Store setup with all terms explained along the way
Understood what products, paywalls, and placements are
Installed the SDK with clear instructions for their package manager
Displayed a paywall with fully explained code
Ran a sandbox test purchase and understood the sandbox concept
Found troubleshooting help when something went wrong

scenarios.name: Understand Adapty concepts
scenarios.goal: Learn what products, paywalls, placements, and access levels are before writing code
success_criteria: Found a clear explanation of each core concept (product, paywall, placement, access level)
Understood how the concepts relate to each other
Didn't need external resources to understand the terminology

personas.name: Vibecoder
personas.background: Developer who primarily builds apps using AI coding assistants (Cursor, GitHub Copilot, ChatGPT, Claude). Has a working app but limited deep understanding of the underlying APIs and infrastructure. Copies code from AI output, tweaks until it works. Comfortable with prompting but not with debugging complex integration issues. May have built the whole app through vibe coding.
goals: Get Adapty working by feeding docs to their AI tool
Copy-paste minimal code that just works
Avoid deep-diving into store configuration details
Use the LLM-friendly doc formats Adapty provides
Get unstuck quickly when AI-generated code doesn't work
pain_points: AI tools hallucinate Adapty API calls that don't exist
When AI-generated code fails, hard to debug without understanding the system
Store configuration (App Store Connect, Google Play Console) can't be AI-assisted easily
SDK version mismatches between what AI knows and current version
Doesn't know which error is from Adapty vs from the store vs from their code
typical_questions: How do I give this doc to Cursor/Claude?
What's the simplest code to show a paywall?
My AI wrote this code and it doesn't work, what's wrong?
Is there a complete working example I can copy?
What's the llms.txt file?
Can Claude/ChatGPT just do the whole integration for me?

scenarios.name: AI-assisted iOS integration
scenarios.goal: Use Cursor or Claude to integrate Adapty into an existing iOS app
success_criteria: Found how to feed Adapty docs to AI tools (llms.txt, .md urls, copy-for-LLM)
Understood which steps must be done manually in dashboards vs which the AI can code
Got minimal working code to show a paywall
Found sample apps to validate AI output against

scenarios.name: Debug AI-generated integration code
scenarios.goal: Figure out why the code Cursor/ChatGPT generated doesn't work
success_criteria: Found tips for better prompting with Adapty docs
Found error code explanations that are understandable without deep Adapty knowledge
Could identify whether the error is from Adapty, the store, or their own code
Found a working sample app to compare against

scenarios.name: AI-assisted React Native integration
scenarios.goal: Use AI tools to add subscriptions to a React Native app
success_criteria: Found platform-specific AI integration guide
Got correct package name and install command for the AI to use
Found minimal working code
Found reference implementation to validate AI output
